alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 26 at 5:29AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of DownEast Maine, including the following counties, Hancock and Washington. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 529 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ellsworth, Bar Harbor, Bucksport, Blue Hill, Machias, Lubec, Eastport, Cherryfield, Deer Isle, Dedham, Jonesport, Castine, Steuben, Stonington, Harrington, Perry, Pembroke, Jonesboro, Columbia Falls and Verona Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
